data.name: Allow iPad to lock when in Active911

duplicates.name: Allow iPad to lock when in Active911

description.body: **THIS IS INTENTIONAL. THE iPAD MUST REMAIN ON IN ORDER TO REPORT IT'S POSITION. IF REPORTING THE POSITION IS NOT A FEATURE YOU ARE WANTING TO USE, PLEASE HIT THE HOME BUTTON OR TURN THE SCREEN OFF WHEN YOU WANT THE iPAD TO SLEEP.** Please change the application to allow the iPad to sleep.  Today, if you leave Active911 open on the iPad, it will not allow the iPad to sleep, or lock the screen.  This leads to the iPad screens in our trucks almost always on, using more energy and wear & tear.

admin_response.body: iPads follow the general device timeout settings and have an option to adjust it specifically for Active911 within the settings of the app.

data.name: Non Emergency Message

description.body: The ability to send out a non emergent, non-respondable event. Such as a text page only, that way the message is delivered, but the responding options aren't available.
The ability to send and receive a message from the app to an individual or group.

duplicates.name: The ability to send some messages just texts to individuals, groups or the entire department (not as an "alert").

description.body: As we have all our member's cell numbers input into system, it would be great to be able to send them non-emergency texts that show up as a text and not an "alert" so there is no confusion about if they are receiving an actual emergency call.  Some other app's do have this feature which was handy to inform members of practice topics, routine maintenance items, socials & events.

data.name: Hydrant distance to scene

description.body: Being able to click on a hydrant on the map and not only get the hydrant spec but the distance to the scene

admin_response.body: All of our clients have a long press option (Windows PC is right click) from a spot to draw a line.  That will report the distance from the location to the scene.

data.name: Adding Hydrants from the Phone

description.body: Right now it seems the only way we can add hydrants is with lat/long on a PC.  This is a real pain.  It'd be a lot better if we were on scene we could add a hydrant real-time.

admin_response.body: This is available on iOS, Android, and Windows PC.

data.name: Multiple devices

description.body:
Add the ability to have multiple devices per person (cell, tablet & email) so that everyone doesn't show up multiple times on the responding list and on the map as a position.

This could involve linking responses and position reporting to the last known response or geofencing and aggregating the information in some way.

data.name: Mutual aid department Map

description.body: ability to see mutual aid department Maps where their hydrants and other marked items are

admin_response.body: Our current iteration requires a user in charge of sharing to have "Edit Locations" permissions on each agency that wants visibility into the data points.  There is a linked item for creating a global map share where anyone in active911 can see your data here.

data.name: Seeing Time stamps of responding on calls

description.body: We want a way to track when our users view an alarm, when they hit responding and when they have arrived and it would be nice if it was in an exportable format so we can use it for reporting.

admin_response.body: The timestamps of responding on calls can be found from iOS and android in the alert details under report.  Both will be able to email a report.  You can also download responses from the website, under the alarms tab is a button called export.

data.name: customized alert sounds

description.body: Would it be possible to make an option to customize alert sound?

It would be nice to be able to set different tones for different types of alarms. For example have the ability to set the CAD page tone for a structure fire alarm and Leroy Jenkins for medical/EMS alarms

duplicates.name: Different Alert sounds at night then during day

description.body: I would like the ability to automatically have a much louder and/or annoying sound at night to wake me up easier. This way during the day the alert sound can be a more normal sound and then at night have a loud high pitched tone automatically switched.

duplicates.name: iOS Alert Tones Same As Android

description.body: The android version of Active 911 features different tones, such as the air raid siren. Can those be made available on the iOS version?  Thank you!

data.name: To Station Button

description.body: I think that an additional repsonse button titled To Station would be a huge benefit for volunteer depts. Knowing who enroute to the station to cover or respond to an incident would great.

admin_response.body: With the ability of the agency to customize response buttons, you can define something like "ToSta" as a valid response to track who is going to the station.

data.name: Custom Duty Schedules

description.body: Allow the individual users to be able to set their own filter for duty schedule. Would be great to have this on web, but better if you can do in-App.
We would like some kind of way to create custom schedules that work for our agency.  Something that allows us to name and define a week or two week period of on and off shifts.

duplicates.name: All user to set duty schedule

description.body: allow all user to set their own duty schedule, not just admins

duplicates.name: Set multiple shifts for one person

description.body: Would like the ability to set more than one shift for a single user.  For example I work a shift where I only want to receive alerts from 2:00pm to 10:00pm Monday through Friday, and then from 6:00am to 10:00pm Saturday and Sunday.  Currently I am not able to set a shift in this manner.

data.name: Landing Zone

description.body: Make  LZ tab in the map data area for Landing Zone for helo's

data.name: Who's available (On Duty) report/export feature.

description.body: Being able to track manpower available per day can increase ISO rating. It would be nice to be able to archive a list or at least export a daily report on who was available and for how many hours did users remain available for record keeping.

data.name: Integrate pre-plans with alarms

description.body: Would like to be able to pull up pre-plans directly from an alarm. At minimum, would like to be able to pass an external link that would open a URL in the browser - we would host our pre-plan docs on our own server and have our dispatch center send the link through with the call. Another option would be for Active 911 to enable uploading floor plans and pre-plan documents directly to your server, and your system would recognize when a dispatched address has a pre-plan document, and would have a button to open the plan. If we wanted to get really fancy, Active 911 would allow not only uploading of floor plans and pre-plans, but would have pre plan map locations that would highlight on the map things like: primary/secondary water source, first level/second level staging, closest LZ, etc.

data.name: Webview Night View

description.body: We would like the ability to switch between an day and night view on the webview. We have currently laptops in the firetrucks and will be adding iPads to the ambulances and a darker night view would be better on the eyes.

admin_response.body: We envision Webview as more of a big display solution.  We have Windows, iOS, and Client apps for MDT's and apparatus devices.  Go here for iOS night view

data.name: Continuous Alerting for heavy sleepers/noisy areas

description.body: Allow the ability to set a particular group or call to continuously alert the device until acknowledged. This is for the heavy sleepers who do not hear the first tone.
After initial call is dispatched and sent to the device, have a reminder beep go off every minute (up until 10 minutes) until the call is acknowledged or viewed/watched.

Option to set Active911 to continue to alert via tone and vibration until acknowledged by pressing on screen button.  Sometimes miss the single alert when working in noisy area and pager dosen't always work around running machinery. Something like FireAlert on Android which worked well for this on SMS messages.

seems like Active911 for android only has a one time audio alert unlike cadpage which gives selection. A choice of 'How many audio alerts in a set time'. 1 to 4 or even 5 would be nice in a 1 or 3 minute period. Currently one audio alert can easily be overlooked, especially in a noisy enviroment. Having more audio alerts in a set time would greatly help. That is one advantage CP had that was conveinent. thanks

We have an issue with people opening an alert but not selecting there status. Would it be possible to add a setting that will continue to send them an alert, maybe every minute or until they make a selection.

data.name: Audible alert when users select Respond

description.body: Would like to have an audible alert when an individual selects responding along with some sort of audible voice with there unit number. This would allow those who are driving to the station to know if anyone else is coming without having to look at their phone while driving. For example, when John Smith (who would be unit 1789) selects responding you could hear (very audible tone) 1-7-8-9 responding. This of course should be an optional feature per user as some may not want to hear this.

data.name: Add Map Data Directly from Webview Map

description.body: Would be useful to click on a location in Webview or on the map within the client and have the LAT/LONG data automatically available to populate into their respective fields in the Add Location form.

custom_fields.name: I need it...
custom_fields.value: Not Sure -- just thought it was cool

data.name: On/Off Duty status display on Phones

description.body: Have the abilty to go into the personnel section of the Active911 app and see who is Around and who is not around. Personnel use the current toggle button under the app settings to go off duty on duty, as soon as the switch it, this shows the change in the personnel section of the app. This is needed for our Fire Station, as we do not run on shifts, we run on who ever is aviable when the call comes to us.

admin_response.body:
This was an anticipated use case of assignments. As Chris explains:

You could create a tab in the assignment that says "available" and unavailable. Personnel could switch their assignment from available to unassigned from the settings on their phone. It would make it possible for you then to click the personnel tab and see who is available in your area.  On the PC web-view, on the right side it will show who is available then without there even being a call.

data.name: Windows App

description.body: Our agency uses mostly windows phones and tablets.  When is there going to be a windows Active911 app?

data.name: Clients - Silent/mute Button Override

description.body: Have an option in the settings to sound the alerts when the device is on silent mode. To prevent missed alerts when the user is unaware or forgotten the device is on silent.

duplicates.name: IOS: Audible alert when on silent mode

description.body: Allow app to broadcast an audible alert much like the Wake Up alarm even when phone is on vibrate mode.

duplicates.name: iOS APP. -  Do not Disturb Override

description.body: To Be able to override my do not disturb. I might want to not get Phone calls/emails/text because I might be sleeping but I would like to still be able to be woke up for a call.

duplicates.name: Wake up Feature - Activate/Wake up your cell with ring/alert tone even if your phone is on vibrate only

description.body: It be useful if you should forget to turn the volume up on your phone...you would still hear the alert and be able to respond...especially if you are sleeping

data.name: Edit Map Data From Map

description.body: Enable a feature that will allow a user that is an administrator to click on a map point and edit the info. Ex - Click on a hydrant and edit the description versus going through the pages of map data lists to find the hydrant and edit the data.

admin_response.body: This is currently available on iOS. Android and Windows PC are being fit into the schedule.

data.name: Badge Icon lights to indicate calls

description.body: Add a number of calls indicator to the app icon on mobile.

duplicates.name: Badge Icon lights to indicate calls

description.body: Is there a way for the badge icon to show at a glance if it has been activated. Just as a e-mail shows you have mail waiting or a missed phone call etc. This would eliminate having to open active 911to see if you have missed calls!

duplicates.name: Red Badge for Notification on App

description.body: Add a badge icon on the widget of the app to signify how many missed notifications they have within our app.

feature.name: As [ Jim Neal, an iOS User ] I want to [ see how many unread calls I have in Active911 before its open ], so that I can [ know if I've unexpectedly missed an alert ].

data.name: Desktop Notifications

description.body: Having the ability to have the website receive pages on a computer would be handy.

admin_response.body: Our Windows PC Client is compatible on any Windows OS since XP, it can provide desktop notifications with sounds.

data.name: Using our own County Maps for mapping

description.body: Our agency would love to use our own GIS Map data to provide mapping for our incidents. Google maps is okay, but our maps are better.
We would like the ability to upload new map-data from Google Earth, or Google Street view. Bing map is terribly outdated.

initiative.name: Expand Wiz to be available to everyone, build maps from it

data.name: Messaging

description.body: The ability to send and receive a message from the app to an individual or group.
The ability to send out a non emergent, non-respondable event. Such as a text page only, that way the message is delivered, but the responding options aren't available.

admin_response.body: Duplicate. refer to Non emergency messaging

data.name: Chat Alert

description.body: Would like to hear a notification sound for when a message is sent through. Should also be able to open the app through the notification
Would be very helpful and useful if the ability to receive notifications for chat messages was an option. Also, within the chat...the ability to talk to the entire account or specific subgroups.

custom_fields.name: I need it...
custom_fields.value: Not Sure -- just thought it was cool

data.name: More Response Buttons

description.body: We need more response buttons, When we were considering Act911 I was told by one of your reps over the phone that this was being worked on. We need a minimum of 8 Customize-able Response Buttons, Adding one more row of 5 would be Great.

duplicates.name: Time Stamping various phases of an incident

description.body: For example: enroute, on scene, at Patient, enroute to Hospital, clearing, back in quarters.
Adding another response selection button. We have run out of buttons for our department, but require 1 or 2 more to be as efficient as possible.

custom_fields.name: I need it...
custom_fields.value: By the end of the Quarter

data.name: Weather Alerts

description.body: Add an alert for weather warnings, and add an option for including the current weather to outgoing alerts.

data.name: Night theme for iOS

description.body: Add a night/dark theme for iOS.
Similar to the Androids, a darker background for night time would be nice on the iOS version.

data.name: Allow agency ability to edit parsing

description.body: Allow us the ability to edit our a911 fields and add more fields when provided by our Central Dispatch. Allow agencies the ability to select who can see what fields, such as officers being able to see more information etc...

data.name: Active911 clients need the ability to set a non-alert tone for messages that are not calls.

description.body:
It gets confusing when both messages and calls come through the app with the same tone. After awhile, calls start being ignored because they sound like just another station staffing request or weather report.


From the forum:

 

http://community.active911.com/discussion/704/administrative-text-messaging


We would like to see a way to send an alert with a second tone or as a text message rather that the standard emergency alert tone.  This would be useful to send administrative and non-emergent messages rather than causing alarm fatigue

description.body:
From the forum:

http://community.active911.com/discussion/704/administrative-text-messaging

description.body: One sound for calls and one sound for messages.

data.name: Customizable Scheduling

description.body: We would like some kind of way to create custom schedules that work for our agency.  Something that allows us to name and define a week or two week period of on and off shifts.

Have the ability to set the default times on the event scheduler. We use it to have our volunteers signup for 24 hr shifts our shifts are 0800 to 0800. I would also like to see the scheduler have a permission to add & view, but not edit or delete. This way volunteers can add their shifts without accidentally removing someone else's shift.
Allow the individual users to be able to set their own filter for duty schedule. Would be great to have this on web, but better if you can do in-App.

admin_response.body: Duplicate of Custom Duty Schedules.

data.name: Automatically display hydrants near scene

description.body: The map display should automatically highlight/display hydrants that are within a user-set distance to a scene (i.e. 1/4 mile, 2-blocks, etc.).  All hydrants being visible and displayed make a map cluttered unnecessarily.  Displaying only hydrants near the scene would be an added value for quick reference by an officer.  Hydrant specs embedded in the icon like many suggestions discuss is also helpful for quick reference.

The map display should automatically highlight/display hydrants that are within a user-set distance to a scene (i.e. 1/4 mile, 2-blocks, etc.). It would be great if a member of multiple agencies could filter toggle to either view or close map markers from the agencies they are apart of. If they only want to view the FD map points, they will have the option to filter out the map points that are linked to their EMS account.

duplicates.name: Automatically Show Two Closest Water Supplies To Address

description.body:
When you click on the address and the map pops up, it would be nice if also the two closest water supplies show up on the map. And then if you click on the water supply it will show the details that you wrote for that supply, but also show the distance (in feet) from the address to the water supply.

Also including an option to set distance parameters so that you know if the water supply is going to be a hose lay or a tanker shuttle. For example: set up a parameter so that if you click on the water supply and its over 2500', it says that it would be a tanker/tender shuttle from the selected water supply instead of a hose lay. 

This would be extremely useful for responding units and also very useful for dispatch to have access to as well.

Hydrant specs embedded in the icon like many suggestions discuss is also helpful for quick reference.

data.name: Select Alert Tone Based on Groups or Filters

description.body: Would like to be able to select alert tones depending on which groups are paged.  For example, my unit would be group and associated with a particular tone.  Other units in our district would sound a different tone when they are dispatched. This would allow for a unit to be audibly alerted when they are dispatched, but also be aware of when other units are dispatched.  This would be great for supervisors/chiefs to keep track of all activity, but to be alerted specifically when they are part of the assignment.

description.body: Sort the alarm responders list by responding, not responding, name, location, etc.

duplicates.name: I would like the response data to be in seperate columns so I can sort the data.

description.body: The response column currently has all of the responses and can't be sorted for type of response. I would like to be able to see who arrived, who was unavailable, etc.

duplicates.name: Clients - Add sorting to the personnel page

data.name: Map Layers

description.body: Option to view or close map data layers from different agencies. For example. In my town, there are several members who are on both the fire department, EMS squad, and even other near-by fire departments. It gets confusing sometimes looking at a map that includes combined map data from each agency. Sometimes the agencies use different symbols, they may overlap each other. It would be great if a member of multiple agencies could filter toggle to either view or close map markers from the agencies they are apart of. If they only want to view the FD map points, they will have the option to filter out the map points that are linked to their EMS account.

Be able to layer maps and toggle maps. Hydrants, Preplans Hazards Water Supply ETC make it where you can add categories to the map.  With all the hydrants, you cant add preplans, hazards and such because it gets too busy.

data.name: Central dispatch main screen

description.body: Just have a list of multiple departments who's responding so dispatch doesn't have to repage Option for be for dispatch only. ie our dispatch dispatches for 34 departments and 10+ use active911 but no way for dispatch to see all of them.

data.name: Turn off the Chat feature

description.body: We want to be able to disable the chat feature for my agency.

duplicates.name: Ability to Disable Chat Function for Entire Agency

description.body: My agency originally went with Active911 over Echoresponder due to the fact that A911 did not have a chat feature. Our legal department had concerns regarding the transmission of HIPAA data over it. While I disagree with their reasoning completely and see the huge advantage of having an in-app chat feature, I would really like to have a safety net to fall onto if they threaten to take away the app due to HIPAA concerns. I know that this feature is still in the early stages and hasn't yet been released for Android, but could you create a way for an administrator to enable/disable the chat function for an entire agency? I know I have heard of other agencies' legal entities having this HIPAA concern as well.

feature.name: As [ Captain Jeremy Wade, an Administrator of Frederick County ], I want to [ turn off chat for all my department ], so that I can [ avoid potential misuse that would result in losing Active911 ].

data.name: RSS feed should allow for some customization: option to scrub address number, leave street name.

description.body: The RSS feed is a good feature, however, it includes too much info for public posting on social media, with no customization ability.  I would like to see the ability to leave street name but scrub the address number for posting of incidents to social media.  Also, ability to scrub non-incident messages.

description.body: A simple method of returning data back to dispatch to determine status of a unit, either responding, on scene and available. Via SMTP or other protocol.

data.name: Badge Icon lights to indicate calls

description.body: Is there a way for the badge icon to show at a glance if it has been activated. Just as a e-mail shows you have mail waiting or a missed phone call etc. This would eliminate having to open active 911to see if you have missed calls!

data.name: PTT - Push to Talk Option

description.body: A push to talk feature built into active911 or in lieu of starting scanner radio start an application like Zello which can be connected to base radio repeater. For volunteers who do not carry radios this allows for an on scene or enroute communication option.

data.name: Report to spouse

description.body: Automatic text message to spouse,  that one is on a call...  Would be great for on call/volunteer departments...

It would be nice for a user to be able to share an alert with another person via email or text message. Ex) I am a member of a Technical Rescue Team that my wife is not a member of & I would like to be able to send her phone that alert as a text message so she is aware of the call. Currently I have to take a screenshot of the alarm & send it to her as a picture.

data.name: iOS Background GPS Should Report Device's Location At All Times

description.body: The new "Background GPS" feature within the iOS app stops reporting the position of a device after it is idle/stationary for an unspecified period of time. Users want this feature to report the position of their devices, even when the device is stationary/idle.

duplicates.name: Device stays on map when the device is stationary and using background location reporting

description.body: When the iOS app is using the background location reporting feature, if the device is stationary for about 5 minutes or longer, the device drops from the map. When the device starts moving again it takes about a minute for the device to reappear on the map. The device should stay on the map despite being stationary for a long period of time.

feature.name: As [ Chris Eiker, an iOS User ] I want to [ have always on continue to report position, even If the device is stationary ], so that I can [ look at the map at any given moment and find all my apparatus ].

data.name: Ability to review a devices activity for a given time period

description.body: We are an all volunteer fire department and currently have in excess of 100 members.  Our active 911 subscription is for 70 devices; going above would require permission from the Villages Board of Trustees due to it being a budgetary item.  The ability to generate a report for activity to see which devices are not using the program to free up space for other members who would like to would be a very useful feature.

data.name: Override Phone When Alert Comes Through

description.body: To be able to have your phone close out of all functions when an alert comes through. Have the ability though to turn this function off if not wanted. This way if someone is doing something on there phone, I.E facebook or another app, that it would automatically close it out and the alert pop up on the screen to make sure that the alert is seen by the individual.

data.name: Custom Vibration String

description.body: Add a custom vibration string option so the user can specify the exact length of the vibration. This is usually accomplished with a comma-separated string of integers representing seconds or milliseconds. The values represent the time spent ON, then OFF, alternating. Example: 1000,200,1000,200,1000 would vibrate for one second three times, with 0.2 seconds between the vibrations.

duplicates.name: As an Active911 Client User, I need the ability to customize the vibration pattern for alerts.

description.body: In a loud environment, the audible notification can be hard to hear, so a customizable vibration pattern is needed for the iOS.
Along with changeable tones how about a longer vibrate (or just vibrate)?

duplicates.name: Custom Vibration on iPhones just like Android devices

description.body: You can set vibration types on Andriod devices, but iPhones don't have but only 1 vibrating alert. This way one can distinguish when a call comes across the phone from Active 911 versus a standard text, email, voicemail, etc alert. What about this possibility? Thank you for all the hard work!!

data.name: The ability to map different fire districts/zones by plotting lines.

description.body: This would be a great way to distinguish zone lines or fire districts for things such as multiple stations or mutual aid. It would be nice to be able to plot lines sort of like a new tab such as a hydrant.
Would like to be able to add icons to Map Data and not add an icon, just show the description instead, like for Apartments or building numbers, so you know which ones to go to.

At our ambulance corps we are dispatched as a station number, however we have what we call a north truck and a south truck under that one station number.  Currently we use the flag drop points to differentiate between the north line and the south line.  I would like to see an actual drawable line that can be a clear line to differentiate between the north territory and south territory or however the individual companies would like to use such a line for.

data.name: Add county borders to maps

description.body: Seeing county border lines in the map view would be very beneficial to determine jurisdiction on alerts. It looks like Active911 leverages google for its mapping and this is already a feature of Google Earth. Hopefully this can be done.

custom_fields.name: I need it...
custom_fields.value: By the end of the Quarter

data.name: Ability to Add Custom Labels To Mapping Area

description.body: Looking for the ability to map an area with building numbers, building letters, milemarkers, ETC that are viewable directly from the map, rather than clicking a map marker to see what it is labeled as.  This would be beneficial in large scale facilities, entrances to facilities, interstates and turnpikes, etc...Coming from being a user on IAmResponding (Oops did I do that?) it is one thing that I miss greatly.  We have multiple facilities where this could be useful when mapping does not direct you to the exact location in a facility.

data.name: Allowing viewing of device profiles in the phone-based clients

description.body:
Each responder name in the response list for each call and in the personnel list should be clickable, and a click should bring up that device's/user's profile.

Especially in volunteer agencies, it is necessary to have access to radio signatures and phone numbers to aid offline coordination between responders going to a call. data.name: Add Call Timer

description.body:
This type of timer is an actual clock that is in bays of fire stations
throughout the country and they are known as turnout timers. The time starts at 0 and goes
up to a designated time set by the department to show how much time has lapsed since the
call was originally dispatched. It helps in career departments by showing firefighters how
long it is taking them to get geared up and out the door. It does the same with
volunteer/combination departments plus it gives crews an ability to see how long their
response is taking and in some situations if they should wait for more members to arrive
at the station or if too much time has already lapsed and that it is time to respond to
the scene. I am thinking this should be more of a selectable option for departments on a
cases by case basis that they can chose rather than something that is just automatically
integrated into everyone’s system.

description.body: When it comes to getting to the call Active911 presently has connections with Google Maps and Apple Maps but neither of these services take traffic/construction into account when making routing decisions. Waze, on the other hand, takes live traffic, construction, and accident data into account when routing its users. Waze also recently released a SDK and I think it would be awesome for Active911 to integrate with Waze to help responders always take the fastest route to the call (or to the hospital) based upon current road/traffic conditions.

duplicates.name: Solving Communication for road closures routing!

description.body:
Okay!, Many apps can do the same routing system showing the user the route from point A to point B at the call. The problem solving issue is the routing app (active 911) and others that are using a map interface (google, tom tom, etc..) which handles road closures. I believe the issue is (and I maybe wrong) Active 911 builds on this map interface and adds layers per the user map preference. I understand "active 911" is unable to collect and communicate like these mapping systems.

Solving this issue would take adding the Waze mapping platform to the mapping selection for the user. I'm one of many map editors for Waze and a firefighter. There is a waze team that tracks and verifies all hard road closures to the massive waze mapping tracking system.

If your team of research & developers can see if this mapping platform meets your requirements and can be added into your application this would resolves this issue. Hope this can bridge the gap in this issue. Waze

 

Thank you, and look forward to see the active 911 turn into and stay the best app for first responders to use.

 

Marcas Houtchings

data.name: Clients: Pre-Plan Data Entry

description.body: Active911 is in the business of helping public safety agencies get the information they need to respond to emergency calls and making emergency response more efficient. Pre-planning is an essential part of an effective response to emergency incidents. Currently, our department uses MDC's in all of our apparatus, but would like to transition to iPads utilizing the Active911 app because of its versatility and cost effectiveness. One feature that makes us hesitant to make that transition is the ability to edit pre-plans in the field. The way Active911 is set up now, our staff has to create a pre-plan image on the desktop, upload those files from our desktop to the Active911 account, then look up the longitude and latitude to make sure we get it in the right location. When we need to edit pre-plan information, we have to do this process all over again. This lacks the portability/availability and time-saving features that Active911 is known for. Idea: - Create a pre-plan tab for the app, a database of searchable pre-plan data for that particular account. - Give specific devices the authority to edit pre-plan data. - Allow devices to drop a point on a map, and create a pre-plan for that location. - Allow devices to enter pre-plan information into a form. This would contain basic information such as utility locations, hazards, contact information, construction type, occupancy classification, number of stories, square footage/fire flow, fire alarm systems, fire sprinkler systems, etc. - Ability to view pre-plans directly from the call sheet based on the address of the emergency. This would be a huge step forward for Active911, giving departments better capability to make their pre-plans readily available and, more importantly, keep them accurate. Thanks for all your company does for us and we hope to see this feature In-Progress soon!

I would like to see the ability to do a pre-plan inside of Active911. This info would then be saved and available during responses from the map. Streetwise Cadlink has this ability built into their app and it seems very useful. Without integration into reporting systems it is difficult to get to the pre-plans in a timely manner when responding to calls. If there was an integration in place for reporting systems this idea would be unnecessary.

data.name: I want to always know where a device is

description.body: Enable an Always on Device setting so they are always visible on the map

I would like to see the option to have the device location always displayed on the map regardless of whether they are responding or using the mapping function.  At this time a device typically only shows on the map once they have acknowledged a call and used the mapping function.  Our dispatch office has a web view set up and it would be helpful for them to see the locations of companies at all times.

I believe the GPS tracking only works for 30 minutes or so after units go responding?  I think it would be better for it to continue to work for the duration of an incident.  For law enforcement, units conducting surveillance could maintain better situational awareness if they knew the location of every other unit on the detail.  Being able to see the locations of the other units on a map would be a great feature to have.  This would also apply to fire incidents.  For example, on a search and rescue incident in a forest, each member of the search team and the incident commander could see the position of each unit in real time.  Another potential benefit is one of enhanced responder safety.  Assume you run an EMS call in the winter, transport to nearest hospital, and then go available by radio, but then, on your way back to the station, you slide off the side of a mountain.  It would be nice if someone could find you once it was determined that you were overdue and failed to answer the radio.  Our units do not use AVL, so having this type of capability added to the app would be very useful.  There are likely other potential uses for GPS mapping for the duration of the incident, but these are just a couple that immediately come to mind.

data.name: Emergency Responding - Sync ER locations and pre-plans with Active911

description.body:
From the forum:

Wishlist:

  • I would like to see emergency reporting import information from active911 such as hydrant coordinates or vice versa
  • Access to pre plan data saved in ER.
  • Things from Emergency Reporting to Active 911
    • If Occupancy data exists for the address
    • Pre Fire Plan
    • Occupancy type
    • Contacts
    • Pre Plan notes
    • Images
    • Systems
    • Chemicals/hazards
  • Pre plan data transfer to resourses in the map would be amazing
  • Hydrants: Pull hydrant locations and rating color from ER Hydrants module directly to the Active911 map and poll for updates every few hours. This would streamline the process of manually exporting from ER and importing into Active911 and then having to keep up with changes.
  • Occupancies: Pull occupancy name and location from ER Occupancies module to the Active911 map. After the initial map item has been created, sync all pre-plan data and attachments from the ER occupancy and add it to the resources section of that map item. This doesn't necessarily have to be an attachment. It could very well be a form based layout which is accessed from that map items resource button. This would in turn make it easier for imports and updates as ER pre-plan data is already entered in a form/field based fashion. As I mentioned above with hydrants, if this feature could poll for updates every few hours it would reduce the workload associated with having to update pre-plans.

data.name: Custom Address Searches

description.body:
Having the ability to input custom addresses into active 911 just like you would using regular google maps, and still having all of the other benefits of the software. There are two major reasons I think this would be beneficial.

One being that sometimes the correct address might change while responding without sending another alert out. The user could input the new address rather than scroll around on the map looking for it.

The second (and probably more important) reason that this feature would be beneficial is for training. We conduct drills on how to use the software and with programs the past, we could have the ability to input certain addresses that pose special hazards or require special tactics. Using the various features of Active911 vastly improves the response to these types of incidents, but it would be advantageous to be able to give a new user an address, and tell them: "you are dispatched to a reported fire at _______ address. Give me the run-route, water supply, layout distance, hose stretch distance, FDC location, etc. etc. etc." Please advise if this is already possible, and/or if there are any questions about what I am suggesting.

 

THANKS!

We would like to see the time stamp when a person clicks one of the 5 choices we have.  Right now you can see the time stamp of the person under the "Report" section of the alarm details only on the cell phones.  We recently created a policy to fill Overtime, and the policy states a 10 minute time frame will be given for personnel to respond to the OT message.  Persons may click "Yes" or "No" but on the Web Console it does not leave a time stamp, nor is "Reports" under the Alarm Details Window.  I just shows who it was sent to, who responded yes or no, but no time stamp.  If i send the message, and leave the desk or an emergency comes in, an I am past the 10 minute time frame, I wouldn't know who clicked "Yes" or "No" within that 10 minute frame.  This addition WOULD GREATLY HELP US OUT!

 

Thank you.

Ability to schedule recurring reminder alerts for members for pre scheduled events I/E Fundraisers, Training , Meetings etc etc etc

data.name: OOS Hydrant Symbol/Marker

description.body: Could we get a symbol/marker that the agency can change to when a hydrant is out of service.  Say a hydrant with a red circle and a line or an X over it.  Then when it is back on line we just change the symbol/marker.

custom_fields.name: I need it...
custom_fields.value: By the end of the Quarter

data.name: Different Sizes for Different Icons - Hydrants vs Active Incident

description.body:
Need to be able to set different sizes for certain icons. Would like hydrant marker icons to be much smaller than the active call location icon. Making them smaller in the PC app makes the call location icon and unit info icons too small and unreadable.

Also need asap the ability to set the zoom level for current calls. When a call comes in and the app Zooms to the location you can't see anything due to the hydrant icons covering all the streets.

Have pictures available to show the issues...

data.name: Map view online

description.body: Allow editing of map data from a map view, instead of just a list.

custom_fields.value: Not Sure -- just thought it was cool

data.name: Option to set the Windows apps to center on an alert's address

description.body:
When the alert comes in on all of our platforms, we center the map around the alert's address and the route to the address. I have received many requests over the years to have more configuration on the PC app that provides control over things like this. I believe there should be an option that allows the user to specify where they want the alerts to center. 

 

========== Below is the original email that prompted this =============

From: 

Philip Thorburn

 

Would prefer that the address of the alert centres in the map when clicking on the event.   Currently it does not

custom_fields.name: I need it...
custom_fields.value: By the end of the Quarter

data.name: Allow call lead or organizer to elect to get notifications of responses

description.body:
Add an option to allow a user to elect to receive push notifications of responses to a single call. After turning on the option for a single call, that user would be notified when other users respond: "two additional responses", etc.

This would prevent the (typically) one person in the agency who is monitoring responses from having to continually refresh the list and scroll through it looking for new responders, counting the number of responders going to the call, etc. It should be elected on a per-call basis, because this is likely to generate a lot of notifications and would only be appreciated by the person overseeing that call.

data.name: Better tones on PC app & WebView

description.body: Would like more station friendly tones on both the PC App as well as the WebView. We use Active 911 throughout our station and the tones are that of a friendly station subtle nature.

custom_fields.name: I need it...
custom_fields.value: Not Sure -- just thought it was cool

data.name: Create an excel spreadsheet of map data without requiring to contact active911 first

description.body: I would like to be able to create an excel spreadsheet after adding items so I can save it. I would then also be able to sent the spreadsheet to other departments easier. I know we can obtain the spreadsheet however it would avoid an email back to active911admin
Giving the admin the ability to export their own data for Groups, Devices and Users.

data.name: Different ring tones for alarms vs. group message

description.body: Today, a single tone is selected for all events within the Active911 client; it would be nice to know via the ring tone if the notification is one of an actual dispatch, or simply a message sent to the group about an event. This does not require custom tones, just the ability to select two different ring tones based on the incoming message type.

custom_fields.name: I need it...
custom_fields.value: By the end of the Quarter

data.name: Add app support for Tizen OS (Samsung wearables).

description.body:
Currently, only the original Active911 app notification will show on a user's Samsung S2 or S3 watch. An app with a widget for the Tizen OS watches that not only sets off the notification, but at least would display the address, type, and members responding would be helpful.

It would be much easier to check my watch to see the location, or to see who is responding to the station, while I'm responding to the station.

I know developing an app for yet another OS is going to be a pain, but it'd be nice (and safer) to have.
So that the map can display on the cars dash screen rather than having to pick up your phone to check it.  I imagine the iOS folks would like CarPlay support as well. But... Android first!
It would be great to have full integration with the Samsung Gear S3, like the iWatch application. Right now, I just get notifications.

duplicate_of.name: Show address in Android Wear when alert is received.

description.body: Currently Android Wear only shows the alert title when an alert is received. User's from our forums have expressed the desire to have the address displayed. As well as response buttons.

custom_fields.name: I need it...
custom_fields.value: Be honest, when do you really need it?

data.name: Differing sets of responses for different device types

description.body: Two sets of response buttons, both customize-able. One set for apparatus and one set for personnel.
Ability to have a different set of buttons dependent upon which pagegroup the alert is sent through.

duplicates.name: Add Customizable Response for Each User

description.body: Add the ability to change the response buttons to alerts for each user.  For example, a standard set of response buttons for individual members, then the ability to have different response buttons for tablets in an ambulance.

data.name: Staffing

description.body: See what users are staffing the station during the day/night

If a member is staffing the station, have a way for them to add that they are staffing from the app. Maybe also have a start time and an end time that can be entered by the user if they know they will be at the station during a certain time period. And also make this available for the other users to see so they know if there is a crew at station.

data.name: Tracking tools

description.body: Enhance online module tools that allow alarm tracking and sorting. It would be great to be able to breakdown calls by type and have a run count. It would also be great to be able to break down each members record for call responses for the year.

data.name: Local Data Storage and Offline Map (Offline Mode)

description.body: Adding an option to download and store all information uploaded to active911 locally, on the device using the app. (cache map data or load agency GIS maps similar to the PDF Maps application by Avenva, store hydrants, pre-plans etc.) would virtually eliminate load times when pulling up pre-plans, hydrants and using the app from an area with cell service to an area without. With local storage and GIS map uploads as an option, data consumption would also decrease, as I believe once the info is synced, the only thing transmitted and received would be the location of the emergency, responding resource locations and status then maybe initial run routing directions from google/apple as an overlay. Cellular networks being congested/down would be less of a problem as the active911 app would still be useable in regards to basic functions for individuals or single engine companies, if these options were activated. *You would still need some form of internet connection when initially dispatched for active911 to automatically plot the location of the emergency if you are not familiar with the area, but all local data would still be accessible on an offline map, which could be made searchable (via lat & long provided from your dispatch center over the air.) **Offline maps or custom agency GIS maps uploaded to Active911 servers for use with webview may be helpful also.

data.name: Leverage iOS Do Not Disturb setting?

description.body: I understand you can not override the mute button in iOS, but can you leverage the Do Not Disturb feature? Will Apple allow an app to be added to the Do Not Disturb allow list? That way users could just set their phone to Do Not Disturb if they don't want their phone ringing during work, but could still receive audible alerts from Active 911?

duplicate_of.name: iOS APP. -  Do not Disturb Override

description.body: To Be able to override my do not disturb. I might want to not get Phone calls/emails/text because I might be sleeping but I would like to still be able to be woke up for a call.

data.name: Rank next to name

description.body: It would be nice to see what rank we have responding such as Probationary Firefighter (PFF) Firefighter (FF) Firefighter/ EMT (FFE) Firefighter/ EMT Advanced (FFA) Firefighter/ Paramedic (FFP) Driver/Engineer (DE) Apparatus Operator (AO)

duplicate_of.name: Allowing viewing of device profiles in the phone-based clients

description.body:
Each responder name in the response list for each call and in the personnel list should be clickable, and a click should bring up that device's/user's profile.

Especially in volunteer agencies, it is necessary to have access to radio signatures and phone numbers to aid offline coordination between responders going to a call. To make this possible, we currently add badge numbers and phone numbers to each user's "name" field, but that requires extra editing and makes for a long name, which does not always fit on the response screen in the iPhone app.

Instead, if we were able to bring up the user's profile quickly, we could at least see a cell phone number. Ideally, the profile would include a couple of extra fields: secondary phone number and radio signature. The phone number fields should also be clickable in the phone apps, and clicking should bring up the phone's dialer to start a call to the other responder.

data.name: Fire vs. Medical Calls

description.body: Ability to choose dispatches of units based upon type of incident.

admin_response.body: Individual devices can use filtering to determine which groups of calls they would like.  Documentation can be found on our wiki or support can help you get them set up.

data.name: Reporting capabilities for Agency

description.body: You have a nice 30 day look at the calls in a pie chart and breaking them down by category.  It would be nice to have a full reporting capability for calls throughout the year with response time info etc.

data.name: Agency Chat Channel

description.body: Able to have a chat screen to text type responding or asking if member is responding over a chat kinda like IM Andy- I'm responding to the ambulance Ben- okay I'll meet you at the scene. Andy- okay I'll respond

Create a private chat room where EMS department personnel can communicate with other members either individually or as a group.  Include ability for users to build folders to store information for future use (Tx for Septic Shock, etc).
Be nice to have a chat type board inside each incident, automatically fill in there each responders status, and enable us to ask for ETA to the group, instead of having to text each individual

data.name: Calls to be sent to a fax machine

description.body: Allow alert to be sent to a fax. Allowing cad date to be sent to a fax so it's able to be taken with the resonding apparatus.

data.name: Map Data

description.body: Make Map data avalible to everyone like hydrants and other info.

Make Map Data points available to anyone within Active911.

Just what we decide to share.  Ideally would default to one way or the other, but would
allow the agency to select shared or not shared for individual map data points.  For
example, I want shared people to see my hydrants, but not a data point with a gate code. From ticket #2017031310000625

data.name: Sharing mapped data

description.body:
Share by agency instead of having to add all devices from the other agency to our devices to view preplan pdf's.

Worked fine a year ago by having one person from each agency with edit location rights, but no longer

admin_response.body: This is already a feature.  There needs to be an individual with edit locations for both agencies.  Once there is a designated individual, he can open up map data sharing amongst the two departments from his map data tab.

data.name: Another Response Selection Button.

description.body: Adding another response selection button. We have run out of buttons for our department, but require 1 or 2 more to be as efficient as possible.

We need more response buttons, When we were considering Act911 I was told by one of your reps over the phone that this was being worked on. We need a minimum of 8 Customize-able Response Buttons, Adding one more row of 5 would be Great.

data.name: Select a Map Marker Density for each type of Icon

description.body:
For example, I
would like to see a Mile Marker data point, or a Caution Note about a bridge height from a
pretty far out level so that I can plan my route based on it; however I don't need to see
the hydrants or key box information until I zoom in much closer.  To add to it, if there
was a way to add a data point, that if the route comes within so many feet of it, it
somehow pops up.  The example goes back to the note about bridge height.  If my route
takes me through/near it, could it be called out somehow to tell me I need to consider
whether or not I need to take a new route. From ticket #2017031310000625

Have different layers that can be cut off when looking at the map and getting closest markers. Example: we have business markers, hydrant markers and preset landing zone markers on our maps. I would like to be able to cut off hydrants and businesses when searching for closest preset landing zone. Make it so the layer can be name by the agencies according to what's in them. Hydrants layer, business layer, landing zone layer and so on to fit the agencies needs.

We should build an option that specifies which pagegroup should be selected as the default group.

Add an everyone pagegroup, set it as the default group, allow pagegroup editors to set a default.

duplicates.name: Remove everyone from the default pagegroup when sending from devices and website

description.body: It is too easy for someone to accidentally page everyone by forgetting to select the appropriate group.  We need to remove the auto selection and instead return an error if one is not specifically picked.

data.name: Restrict Map Data files to certain users

description.body: I would be nice to be able to restrict the files attached to a map data point to certain users.For example: law enforcement pre-plans on a specific structure.

data.name: Once a month Recurrence on assignments

description.body: In the calendar it would be nice if their was a reoccurring selection for once a month. Our board meetings are the first Thursday of each month and we where adding it to the schedule in the calendar and didn't see a selection for that. Thanks in advance.

data.name: Adminstrative Features on App

description.body: It would be great from an administrator standpoint to be able to edit/change devices, as well as access code's etc. As an administrator for almost 500 devices this proves to be a pain to have to log on or access a computer every time someone needs their code or I need to add/delete people.

data.name: Remove the default everyone feature from client alerting

description.body: I would like the option to have or not to have the page everyone feature we are trying to roll this out to the mutual aid system and when a person has a moment of not paying attention he could send a message sytem wide when he didnt intend to so either an option to not to have it or place it at the bottom so that it would have to be purposefully selected.

Change the functionality of the default group. Currently the Everyone group is selected by default.  I would like to see a feature to be able to change the default group be something other than Everyone.  This could be done at the agency level or individual/device level. Maybe even delete the Everyone group and have each agency create an everyone group if they want.

data.name: Iphone ringtones - more long ringtones

description.body: Please add more long ring tones for the Iphone 5S and greater. The only long tone is Fast Beep LONG  this high pitch is not loud enough.  Please consider adding adding long House Tones and Station Buzz. Also it would be good if the tone could be repeated 30 seconds later if not replied to.

admin_response.body: Apple currently restricts notification sounds to 30 seconds. If we attempt to give them a tone longer than 30 seconds, the operating system overrides it with the system default ringtone.  Until Apple adjusts their stance, this isn't something that is feasible.

data.name: Notify of Units Not in CAD

description.body: If a unit is not in the CAD but others on the dispatch line are, no notification is made. This would ensure all units can be added into the system.

feature.name: As [ Andrew Doyle, an Active911 Admin ], I want to [ use the "missing" group to find missing pagegroup units ], so that I can [ create the proper pagegroups for any unit we are are responsible for ].

data.name: Certification Tracking

description.body: As someone who will be switching over from Iamresponding one of the features they had that was very useful was an option to track certifications of each member. Once a date is entered it notifies individuals of when their certifications expire. This could also be used for Department certifications (ex. Vehicle registrations. DOH Certifications, etc.)

I'd like to have a place to note what service each device uses, such as Verizon, US Cellular, etc. It's hard for me to keep up with this b/c google as killed me by making a separate contact app and screwing everything up so I can't just send everyone an email or text. Damn nightmare...

data.name: Add Staffing

description.body: If a member is staffing the station, have a way for them to add that they are staffing from the app. Maybe also have a start time and an end time that can be entered by the user if they know they will be at the station during a certain time period. And also make this available for the other users to see so they know if there is a crew at station.
See what users are staffing the station during the day/night

data.name: Step-By-Step voice Navigation like a GPS to Multiple locations.

description.body: The ability to be able to choose to have step-by-step voice navigation like a GPS to the scene and then switch to go to an alternate destination such as a hospital or doctors office. Example: Use in a Ambulance style format, Respond to Scene then transporting to Hospital.

data.name: Alert Trends on the Map

description.body: I'd like to be able to map trends. So if we get numerous calls for the same address, the same person, the same type of call from a location or time of day. It would be nice to be able to pull up any repetitive info to be able to gauge trends.
When an alert is triggered, have a history tab on the alert page to see a history of the calls dispatched to the same location.

duplicates.name: Call Heat Map with response times for each zone

description.body: Active 911 has the ability to give a lat and long for the dispatch address.  There should be the ability to generate a heat map of dispatch calls as well as response times for each zone.  That data can be vetted and fractile response times generated.  This should help those agencies in need of increased staffing and generate a GIS map of call volume for risk analysis.  The possibilities are endless.

data.name: Incidents nearby

description.body: Allow incidents to be dispatched to people who ar near the incident. You would select a radius that you want to recieve alerts within so thay you could render aid to patients even if you are off duty. This would be very helpful for getting trained EMS providers onscene to life threatening calls like working codes.

Would like to see a feature that would send alerts to my device only if the call for service was a certain radius from my location.  In other words I'm out and about and I don't want an alert on every single call within out 654 square mile county, but a CPR comes out a few blocks from my location, I want to be alerted.  I could see this as a user defined switch that would allow the user to turn on this feature on/off (due to potential battery drain).  It could also be integrated as one of the on/off duty options.  Maybe I'm on shift and I want to set it to 7a-7p today.  The next day I'm off and want to set it to geofence only.  Would also like the radius to be user defined.

data.name: Allow different names for Multiple use devices

description.body: Currently when a device is added as multiple use the name format must remain the same between departments. Can we get a change that allows different names at each department?

data.name: Export List of Devices

description.body: As the technology officer for my station, I would like the ability to export the list of devices to a CSV file so that the crew chiefs can review it on a monthly basis and  ensure only active riding members are receiving dispatches.  The ability to automate reports would work well with this feature, but the request is for a simple export button/link to accomplish this task.

duplicates.name: I would like a way to print a list from "Devices" showing member, phone number, Device code, etc.

description.body: Would benefit Client Administrators who must track and pay for Agency subscriptions.

feature.name: As [ Shawn Wieczorek, a tech officer ], I want to [ export a list of my devices to a printable format ], so that I can [ easily get my crew chiefs to review the devices for defects on a monthly basis ].

data.name: Interactive Hydrant Map for PC edits

description.body: The current Hydrant entry system works well, and I may be overlooking something, but a interactive map in the PC version in which you can visually see the hydrants and make edits from that map would help tremendously. Plus it would be nice to be able to actually see what you have input into the system and double check locations on the actually maps that will be used by responders. If you could look into this and let me know something I would be appreciative.

description.body: When receiving a bunch of simple alerts (meds,fire alarms etc) or alerts for another station that are not for me I don't even open the alert  and the blue dots stack up. It would be nice to clear all unread alerts with on e tap vs tapping in and out of each one.  I keep the alerts on my phone for a 30 day period to archive  them at which time i delete  all.

The ability to send memos or flyers as attachments to members as an alerts

We could lock page groups, however you then cannot access should you need to select it.

data.name: Australian Mapping Symbol's

When the map is zoomed in, the street names shrink back to their small display.

data.name: Upload Images of locations

data.name: Minimalist Icons - Tiny Dot

data.name: Map specific sounds to specific incident types

description.body: Allow users to dictate specific incident types to be associated with a unique tone. Ex: *If* incident type = HOUSE *then* tone = Station Buzz. Good for callback staff to be alerted without pager or different tone for fire/EMS calls.

data.name: Listen to dispatch

description.body: Would be nice to be able to hear the dispatch traffic so you could tell if the call was canceled or hear the size up

duplicate_of.name: Allow Active911 to listen to our Scanner Channels

data.name: Response buttons tied to a physical location for mapping to that location

description.body: Now that response buttons are customizable, they should be able to be tied to a map data point so that the route that is displayed to the responder  is to that station location instead of the scene location.  If a response button does not have a location assigned to it, the default should then route to the scene of the alarm.  As an example, we have 2 stations, each with a response button.  When the button is press for STA1, the route will show to that location, however if the person is responding to STA2 and presses that button, it will route them to that station.  If instead they are going to SCENE or POV then that location would be blank and it would just route them as it does now to the scene.

data.name: more than one 'Audio Alert'

description.body: seems like Active911 for android only has a one time audio alert unlike cadpage which gives selection. A choice of 'How many audio alerts in a set time'. 1 to 4 or even 5 would be nice in a 1 or 3 minute period. Currently one audio alert can easily be overlooked, especially in a noisy enviroment. Having more audio alerts in a set time would greatly help. That is one advantage CP had that was conveinent. thanks

duplicate_of.name: Continuous Alerting for heavy sleepers/noisy areas

description.body: Allow the ability to set a particular group or call to continuously alert the device until acknowledged. This is for the heavy sleepers who do not hear the first tone.

data.name: Attach files to individual alerts

description.body: We are a Search & Rescue team that has started using Active911. We usually have materials (subject photo, subject profile, topo map, etc) that need to be distributed to our members for each search. Being able to attach a file to an alert would give us the ability to quickly get those materials in our members hands.

duplicates.name: Being able to attach & view documents to alerts.

description.body: Being able to attach IAP's, Situational updates, Status Summaries. Can be usful to incoming units and personnel that are standing by.

data.name: Ramp up alert tones - gradually increasing tone intensity

description.body:

data.name: wiz geocoding improvements

description.body:
While looking at a wiz update a few possible improvements came to mind which we could consider implementing if we want to improve the geocoding accuracy for our users.

 

First we might want to consider gauging impact via metrics on how many users rely on wiz for what % of alerts, and what's the breakdown of the types of results (i.e. exact/approx/interpolated) as well as metrics on over successes vs. failures to geocode. That would help inform the priority of the following (and other similar ideas). 

 

As for the improvements:

1. We shouldn't assume address number 199 is directly in the center of 100 and 200... any algo for a 'weighted' midpoint will likely be more accurate.

2. We should include the knowledge of even/odd addresses and pick two nearest on the same side of the street if possible (like what some other geocoding libraries currently do). 

3. The first point can also be applied to grid addresses w/ it's current implementation.

4. There's another possible improvement for grid address interpolation, but I'm less confident in it so it would need to be tested to see if it actually improves accuracy: find smallest triangle (via 3 known points) which encompasses the unknown point using 2D distance formula (treating grid address numbers like psuedo units). And then find the weighted center (via similar method to 1 above).

 

And on a more general note... it would be nice if we broke wiz apart so it was more modular and we could potentially lean on some existing open source GIS libraries to handle these sorts of things outlined above (and other use cases we have talked about in the past, e.g. more robust parsing + normalization).

data.name: improve alert server monthly log rotation

description.body:
Motivation:

The impetus being that because of way this is currently handled, our reliability is put at risk on two fronts:

1. False alarms can distract/desensitize devops from actual issues.

2. The added load caused by the current method is a risk factor by itself (especially as a compounding effect w/ any other simultaneous problems). 

 

Story:

As a DevOps engineer I want the monthly alert server log rotation to run in a low-impact/low-priority manner to avoid overloading our server resources. 

 

Implementation/technical details:

Currently when the first alert of each month is created for an agency, all the alerts from the previous month are cleared out (some many process scenarios allowed by this design can cause high load spikes). I think this feature should be moved out of the alert server code and instead should be something like an cronjob triggered script that uses ionice to do the same thing over the same time period but in a way which will avoid load spikes.

feature.name: improve alert server monthly log rotation

description.body:
As [Jon a Tier 3 guy] I want [to see the history of changes to the  activation email script] so that I can [effectively diagnose problems with the activation emails]

As [Jon a devOps guy] I want [the script to be deployable out of a repo and updated automatically] so that I can [deploy changes to it quickly and with confidence]

 

The script currently live in the root directory of mcp.active911.com and has a manually added cronjob which runs it each day.

We need to do 3 things:

1) Figure out a repository the script can live in, an existing one preferably but a new repo as a last resort would be acceptable, and push it to that repo

2) Add to puppet deployment of that script from the repo to mcp.active911.com.  Also add the cronjob to the mcp Puppet recipe

3) Remove the manual cronjob and script from mcp

 

We're going to make activation scripts great again!

Okay!, Many apps can do the same routing system showing the user the route from point A to point B at the call. Solving this issue would take adding the Waze mapping platform to the mapping selection for the user. I'm one of many map editors for Waze and a firefighter. There is a waze team that tracks and verifies all hard road closures to the massive waze mapping tracking system.

If your team of research & developers can see if this mapping platform meets your requirements and can be added into your application this would resolves this issue. Hope this can bridge the gap in this issue. Waze

 

Thank you, and look forward to see the active 911 turn into and stay the best app for first responders to use.

 

Marcas Houtchings

Waze, on the other hand, takes live traffic, construction, and accident data into account when routing its users. data.name: Pre-Plan Management and Viewing

description.body: I would like to see the ability to do a pre-plan inside of Active911. This info would then be saved and available during responses from the map. Streetwise Cadlink has this ability built into their app and it seems very useful. Without integration into reporting systems it is difficult to get to the pre-plans in a timely manner when responding to calls. If there was an integration in place for reporting systems this idea would be unnecessary.

Active911 is in the business of helping public safety agencies get the information they need to respond to emergency calls and making emergency response more efficient. Pre-planning is an essential part of an effective response to emergency incidents. Currently, our department uses MDC's in all of our apparatus, but would like to transition to iPads utilizing the Active911 app because of its versatility and cost effectiveness. One feature that makes us hesitant to make that transition is the ability to edit pre-plans in the field. The way Active911 is set up now, our staff has to create a pre-plan image on the desktop, upload those files from our desktop to the Active911 account, then look up the longitude and latitude to make sure we get it in the right location. When we need to edit pre-plan information, we have to do this process all over again. This lacks the portability/availability and time-saving features that Active911 is known for. Idea: - Create a pre-plan tab for the app, a database of searchable pre-plan data for that particular account. - Give specific devices the authority to edit pre-plan data. - Allow devices to drop a point on a map, and create a pre-plan for that location. - Allow devices to enter pre-plan information into a form. This would contain basic information such as utility locations, hazards, contact information, construction type, occupancy classification, number of stories, square footage/fire flow, fire alarm systems, fire sprinkler systems, etc. - Ability to view pre-plans directly from the call sheet based on the address of the emergency. This would be a huge step forward for Active911, giving departments better capability to make their pre-plans readily available and, more importantly, keep them accurate. Thanks for all your company does for us and we hope to see this feature In-Progress soon!

data.name: Change environment from inside the app

description.body:
As an Active911 Employee I want to change the environment my app is pointed to from inside the app so that I don't need a custom build to test the app.

 

We can manually change the access and xmpp servers, but that is error prone and could cause issues, ie someone forgetting to switch the urls back after they finish the feature.

 

There should be some mechanism to hide it so that users can accidently change it themselves, but it doesn't have to be too elaborate since it's not a security risk.  Adding a warning to it would also be good, to let users know they are in uncharted waters.

data.name: Diagnosing alert server problems

description.body:
As a DevOps Engineer, I want to have more logging in the alert server so that I can easily tell which part of the alert process a thread is hung on.

 

Currently, the alert server logs very little to syslog, and the verbose logs that go into the file system don't get written until the process completes.

 

If the process hangs, we have no visibility into where the process is hung.

data.name: Licensing of Map Data - OpenStreetMaps

description.body:
In your recent blog post about the PC version you mentioned problems with licensing data and possibly having the ability to upload our own data to keep costs down.  As an officer of a rural department with a limited budget, your service provides a cost effective way to coordinate with our volunteers and provide decent map data a lot of times, and I appreciate the concerns over budget costs.  Being rural, obviously we have problems with map data as well, even from the big providers.  In some cases our emergency management directors have even tried to GIVE hand verified, GPS coordinated street map and address info to the large providers because of the value it provides to our emergency response crews, but we still have inaccurate map data in many cases.

In some rural areas, a 200ft difference in position of an address on a street can drastically alter the route we must take to get there due to fields, creeks, closed roadways, etc.  Has there been any considering in embracing OpenStreetMaps?

At this point they have very limited address data, but that is something that could be mutually beneficial.  If we elect to use OpenStreetMaps, we keep licensing costs down, and as a department we can contribute our map data back to the OpenStreetMaps project.  Additionally, road closures could be updated by the departments served by the map data.

I understand this is not a desirable approach for everyone, but it may be mutually beneficial to your licensing costs, our budgets and maps, and the open street map project.

data.name: Schedule Auto Alerts

description.body:
It would be great to have a scheduling option for auto alerts, so we don't have to manually create an alert for recurring daily events, or known, scheduled events. It would also be helpful to be able to set them by group, so I could send a daily alert to say, just the chiefs, or anyone with a red card. 

 

Thank you!
Ability to schedule recurring reminder alerts for members for pre scheduled events I/E Fundraisers, Training , Meetings etc etc etc

data.name: Ability to send alerts to individuals from the apps

description.body: Ability to select individual members in Windows 10 Desktop, iPhone, Android .... app's to send messages to.

data.name: Alexa skill

description.body: I am trying to get Alexa or IFTTT to trigger our Hue lights red if we get a call so its a visual cue if your running equipment or miss the audio.

duplicate_of.name: Integration with IFTTT (If This Then That)

description.body: I would like to see full integration with the IFTTT platform.  The platform allows you to set a given action to be taken by your phone or connected service if a specific condition is met, combining activities from two different services. Currently, there are some published workarounds that use the RSS newsfeed, but they require administrative access.  As a volunteer, it would be nice to set up an IFTTT that turns on some of the lights in my house when a structure fire or mva comes in.   Integration could also allow me to geofence, going on/off duty when I cross a threshold if I'm within a given distance of the district.

custom_fields.name: I need it...
custom_fields.value: Not Sure -- just thought it was cool

data.name: Send GPS data via Zoll Road Safety

description.body: Just looking to see if there's any possibility of being able to send vehicle location through Zoll's Road Safety program to Active 911.  We utilize iPad's but disappear from the Active911 when using them to look up protocols, retrieve stored maps, ect.  The RS device can send GPS data to an IP address through a port on the internal computer.  Not sure if this has been done before or if it's even possible?  I imagine it would be similar to a CAD integration?  Have had no luck in searches, Thanks.

As a [ User ]

I want to [ have the app report my position even when it is backgrounded ],

so that I can [ show my position to everyone in the department even if I need a different app open ].

admin_response.body: I think this particular pain point will be addressed by allowing our app to report it's position even while backgrounded on iOS.

custom_fields.name: I need it...
custom_fields.value: By the end of the Quarter

data.name: Mark Areas as tanker vs city

description.body: As a department I would like the ability to mark my responding areas as tanker needed so that when I pull up the map I see that I need a tanker as opposed to having a hydrant available.

At our ambulance corps we are dispatched as a station number, however we have what we call a north truck and a south truck under that one station number.  Currently we use the flag drop points to differentiate between the north line and the south line.  I would like to see an actual drawable line that can be a clear line to differentiate between the north territory and south territory or however the individual companies would like to use such a line for.

custom_fields.name: I need it...
