data.name: Additional Color Options

description.body: Additional color options would be very efficient in the active. In my active we use the colors to associate with hydrants of different GPMs, we are also adding pre plans and target hazards. With our hydrants spread everywhere and of different colors it is hard to distinguish between a hydrant, pre plan, target hazard, ect. It would simply be an easier way to pin point our resources and what they can provide us. I know yellow, black, and brown are not options that may be considered.

duplicate_of.name: Add More Colors for Map Icons and Device Icons

description.body: We could use more than 5 color options for the map icons/device icons. We use RED for fire hydrants, ORANGE for Dead-End Hydrants, BLUE for FDC's and GREEN for Knox Boxes. That leaves us with GREY leftover. Would like more colors added so we can add Fire Stations, Police Stations, Hot Spots, High Rises, Water Towers, LZ's etc.

data.name: Add the ability to quickly enter a map icon/color and description with one push on the map.

description.body: In my town we have several thousand fire hydrants. Our map books are outdated and a lot of new developments are being built in town. I would like to see an option where I can select a map icon/color and description all at once and click a location on the  map to enter it. I would be able to easier add hydrants and other things faster as opposed to selecting the color, name and icon for every individual hydrant. I know we are able to do bulk uploads that way however when doing new developments and things it would be easier. Thank you.

data.name: Productionize the JIRA server

description.body:
Once we've decided if we are going to continue to host and use JIRA, we should do a couple of productionization steps.

 

1) Switch to an actual database backend rather than the H2 database it is currently on

2) Cache a frozen copy of the JIRA image in our own registry to use instead of relying on Dockerhub.  Build from the source if possible. 

2.1) Cache a frozen copy of the simple mailer container we are using to send mail from JIRA

3) Outline deployment, backup, and upgrade strategies, including where the container will live and what URL it will live on.

feature.name: As [ Tier 3 ] I want to [ productionize our JIRA environment ], so that I can [ back it up and maintain it ].

data.name: Map Data Improvements

description.body: Would be nice to enhance the Map Data  features. Add ability to share/not share data points, so that not all data in the list is shared.  Just what we decide to share. Consider a way to identify Home Team data points vs data points from a neighbor.  Maybe a colored border around the icon or fade the icon color a bit.  Another option would be to show all mutual aid data points in grey vs colored for home agency. Develop a better way to share the data points without having to add a user from the other agency.  Also eliminate the need to enable Edit Locations for that user.  Dont want them to edit, just see. Might be a strech, but a way to compare and locate data points with duplicate or very close coordinates. Add Black and Yellow to color choices.

data.name: Map Icon Colors

description.body: I would like to have more color options for icons.
I need more icon colors

data.name: Seeing what groups a device is in.

description.body: When I look at a device there is currently no way to see what groups a device has been added to.  We need some way to see what groups a device is added to without having to look through all groups.

data.name: Windows PC Map Layers

description.body: Would like to remove the responders layer from the map in the PC app, like we can in the phone app.

data.name: Community Access Application

description.body: Create a community app that we can make available to our community. This would allow the App to be available to people like media, city officials, road construction crews etc who you only want to be able to be alerted when you want and not allow them to change the groups and filters or when they receive the alert.

data.name: Override users response selection

description.body: For dispatcher to be able to override a users response selection if they forgot to select an option.

data.name: Audible cues to screen visual info

description.body: When a user clicks responding on the app, have an audible announcement transmitted, like:  John Jones-responding, so all users get audible cues as to who will be involved in the incident and the IC gets cues as to whom he'll have as resources at the incident without having to look down at the screen and scroll through the list of names (hazardous while driving!). Having an audible announcement of the pertinent details of the call that are displayed on the screen, like: Structure fire-1234 Main Street Again, this negates the need to look at the screen while driving to find out specifics of the nature of the incident.

data.name: Aviation Dispatch Routing Option

description.body: I work for a company that has an air medical dispatch program.  It would be nice to have the mapping create a straight line from the present location to the coordinates supplied - since roads aren't used for aircraft.  I think an included designator for ground or air would allow Active911 to plot either the straight line or use the road network for ground units since we can dispatch both. It might also work well to prominently display heading and distance - all supplied to you from the dispatch - in the case of an air response.

data.name: Dispatch (PSAP) Login

description.body: Give the capability to the dispatch center (County 911 PSAP) to have a template with linked agency accounts they are authorized to view, to monitor those specific agencies crews and personnel response statuses.

data.name: Map Marker Layers

description.body: Have different layers that can be cut off when looking at the map and getting closest markers. Example: we have business markers, hydrant markers and preset landing zone markers on our maps. I would like to be able to cut off hydrants and businesses when searching for closest preset landing zone. Make it so the layer can be name by the agencies according to what's in them. Hydrants layer, business layer, landing zone layer and so on to fit the agencies needs.

duplicate_of.name: Select a Map Marker Density for each type of Icon

description.body:
For example, I
would like to see a Mile Marker data point, or a Caution Note about a bridge height from a
pretty far out level so that I can plan my route based on it; however I don't need to see
the hydrants or key box information until I zoom in much closer.  To add to it, if there
was a way to add a data point, that if the route comes within so many feet of it, it
somehow pops up.  The example goes back to the note about bridge height.  If my route
takes me through/near it, could it be called out somehow to tell me I need to consider
whether or not I need to take a new route. From ticket #2017031310000625

data.name: Widget for Assignments

description.body: The assignments feature gives us the capability to set status to meet the needs of the  'Off Duty/On Duty status on Phones' request above, But we need a way to easily allow each firefighter to set their status. Can we get a screen widget, similar to the on/off duty widget, that shows the assignments we have configured and allows the user to quickly set their own status with the press of a button without having to open the app itself. As a volunteer department, we would like to use assignments and the personnel list to see who is in the area and available for calls.  Problem is it's difficult for phone app users to change their assignment - have to go to menu, then settings, then assignment each time to change assignment. We have 4 statuses set up in Assignments:  Available, Out of Area, UnAvailable, Delayed and would like to have firefighters change their assignment to reflect their current availability to respond. I think this would actually make the assignments features of A911 useful for us and other volunteer departments.

Revisit Assignments to see how we can make it more useful for scheduling.

Some things that may help:

https://bart.emerg.com.au/system-tour/ramp/

description.body: The ability to draw polylines to mark unmarked roads and hiking trails and be able to navigate using them.

data.name: Prioritize Pagegroups

description.body: The ability to set the order of pagegroups for the send alert button. There are certain groups that get more calls than others. Being able to set the order would save time in sending out an alert.

I spoke with Tyler and Robert at the Lancaster PA show and they said to post here about adding the ability to add "Sub Groups" under Page Groups. It would benefit large county departments by allowing to condense their large group lists into smaller lists. Example a county with 25 stations would have 25 groups. By clicking on one of those groups (fire station) you could then select the unit you are assigned to that shift.

data.name: Hot Alert Button

description.body: On the main Screen a button or buttons that automatically sends an alert to all members. In my County the dispatchers don't always push/forward the information, also they have trouble with the cad system its old and has been going down a lot. We also have a pull box at HQ's that is not connected to the County. 1, Hot Button (Alert Respond to HQ's. text option for additional info.2, Active Shooter respond to HQ's. with text option.3, Fire Call responded to HQ's. text option to add address.4, Rescue Call. respond to HQ's. text option for address.

Create a button to automatically send a Recall or Disregard Push Alert to users who may not have to ability to listen to an assignment but could still be responding to station or scene. Having a stand alone preset button to send a push alert would be convenient as opposed to having to type out a message every incident....

data.name: More Marker Icon Shapes / Colors

description.body: Need a couple more Marker Icon Shapes / colors for map Data. This gives the responder the ability to quickly recognize special hazards without getting lost with all the other identical markers. Would be nice to add Black, Yellow, and Navy to color options. These would also help with special notices about hydrants out of service or condemned buildings locations.
I need more icon colors

data.name: Add Map to Map Data Tab

data.name: Removing yourself from Agencies

data.name: Helmet Icon and colors for Officer Identification

description.body: Add an helmet map icon to identify officers that are responding to an incident and have all colors to match White Red Yellow Blue Black Orange, understanding that some colors may be hard to see so have a bold border that surrounds the Icon (Example the White Chiefs helmet)
I need more icon colors

data.name: Messaging

description.body: Ability to message with everyone and have it grouped to a certain call. For example, be able to message within a certain call shell so everyone can see it.
Be nice to have a chat type board inside each incident, automatically fill in there each responders status, and enable us to ask for ETA to the group, instead of having to text each individual

data.name: Segregate Map Data Access

description.body: Provide the capability for grouping or filtering of types of Map Data by device such that some data is only available to some devices.  For example, pre-incident plan data is only available to devices in department vehicles rather than to every device activated for individual firefighters.

data.name: Allow groups to have filter options

description.body: Allow for applying filters to a group of devices at once, or to all users in a page group.

data.name: Longer GPS Tracking

description.body: I believe the GPS tracking only works for 30 minutes or so after units go responding?  I think it would be better for it to continue to work for the duration of an incident.  For law enforcement, units conducting surveillance could maintain better situational awareness if they knew the location of every other unit on the detail.  Being able to see the locations of the other units on a map would be a great feature to have.  This would also apply to fire incidents.  For example, on a search and rescue incident in a forest, each member of the search team and the incident commander could see the position of each unit in real time.  Another potential benefit is one of enhanced responder safety.  Assume you run an EMS call in the winter, transport to nearest hospital, and then go available by radio, but then, on your way back to the station, you slide off the side of a mountain.  It would be nice if someone could find you once it was determined that you were overdue and failed to answer the radio.  Our units do not use AVL, so having this type of capability added to the app would be very useful.  There are likely other potential uses for GPS mapping for the duration of the incident, but these are just a couple that immediately come to mind.

duplicate_of.name: I want to always know where a device is

description.body: Enable an Always on Device setting so they are always visible on the map

data.name: Hydrant Color Options

description.body: Add the color black to the color options for hydrant's for if/when a hydrant becomes out of service for maintenance or is inoperable.

duplicate_of.name: Black icon color for oos hydrants.

description.body: Would like to see the Color black for out of service hydrants ?????

data.name: Mass Email Attachments

description.body: Would be nice to be able to attach a file when sending a Mass Email to department members.

data.name: Map Data - timer and ability to delete from iOS device

description.body: Add an option to set a timer to a specific map icon. For instance, if a road is closed, have the ability to place an icon on a map with a timer that will remove the icon on the specified date and time the road is supposed to open.

The ability to add specific start and end dates for a map data point thus not requiring an administrator to physically delete the point it would automatically delete based on the end data. For example: Fire Truck Bridge closure starts on date "X" and work will be finished and reopened on date "Y", on date "Y" the icon in the map data will automatically deleted.

data.name: Removing Unavailable units from list

description.body: It would be nice to have it so that when a user clicks unavailable or clear that there unit ID is removed from the response list on the web view. Then when looking at the station screen only units responding will be listed.

data.name: Require Group Selection When Sending an Alert

description.body: Requiring a user to select the recipient group before sending an alert from a phone or computer would reduce false alarms. Currently, if you accidentally hit Enter the alert goes out as is with no way to stop it. Also, if you forget to select the group you want to send it to then everyone (the whole county in my case) receives the alert.

Change the functionality of the default group. Currently the Everyone group is selected by default.  I would like to see a feature to be able to change the default group be something other than Everyone.  This could be done at the agency level or individual/device level. Maybe even delete the Everyone group and have each agency create an everyone group if they want.

data.name: View the Map from the Map Data  Tab

description.body: View data information/icons in order to verify/edit directly from the map

data.name: Different GPS Formats

description.body: Being in New Zealand the GPS format that we use is Degrees, Minutes, Seconds S and Degrees, Minutes, Seconds E. With Active 911 we can only use the decimal format which our comcen cannot convert.

data.name: Radius Mapping

description.body: Provide a radius mapping option around an address to assist with identifying evacuation zones.

data.name: Select Which map Data I can share

description.body: I am admin for more then one agency that run Mutual aid together. I would like to share all of my pre-plans and floor plans, but not the medical related or HIPPA data between agencies.

data.name: Specific Permission for Pagegroup Forwarding

description.body: It would be nice  to have a separate permissions level than the Pagegroup Level that could forward.  In our case, I'd like to allow lower level users (those that can alert) to be able to forward pages, but not be able to edit the page groups.  The ability to create and modify page groups would then be a higher level permission than that of the forwarding page groups capability.

data.name: Users only view their own group in Personnel

description.body: I have several groups that may respond to a call but each group only wants to see the people in their own group.

duplicate_of.name: Clients - Add sorting to the personnel page

description.body: When viewing devices that have signed up.  It would be nice to reorder the list either alphabetically, or by device type, or by person color...

data.name: Change how data is shared between other accounts

description.body: Currently the only way to share the data with another account is to add the email address from another account, as a user within your own account.  This seems to give an unnecessary permission to that user, which is not needed.  Additionally, if that user is removed from the other account, the data sharing is broke. Instead, change the linking based on the account number (agency ID), account email address for alerts, use the RSS feed code, or use a new identifier that is attached to the account, but not to a specific user.  This would allow users to come and go within the accounts and not interrupt any sharing of information with other accounts.

Make Map Data points available to anyone within Active911.

Just what we decide to share.  Ideally would default to one way or the other, but would
allow the agency to select shared or not shared for individual map data points.  For
example, I want shared people to see my hydrants, but not a data point with a gate code. From ticket #2017031310000625

data.name: Alarms By Type user parsing

description.body: Currently, at least with our view, we receive 'alarm by type' (Agency tab) data broken down into two categories; EMS or Other.  If, in a format similar to the Group Paging, each agency could define the alarm types as sent by their dispatch agency, the data and pie chart would be of greater value. The graph could not only represent each individual call type as defined by the agency, but also a broader definition Example: EMS = MED, MEDX, BLS, BLSN. Fire = FR, FC, FB. etc. The user could select a pie chart and data listing based upon either the Grouping or drilled down to the actual call type. In addition, date ranges could be specified or at least a preset range: This month, Last Month, Year to Date, Last 2 months, Last year, etc.

feature.name: Alarms By Type user parsing

data.name: Agency Wide Filters that can be applied to devices

description.body: Instead of individual filtering in devices to allow pages to come through like Backfill even when off shift, it would be nice to let admin set up an all device filter.  This way it doesn't have to be done on each individual device

data.name: Set multiple shifts for one person

description.body: Would like the ability to set more than one shift for a single user.  For example I work a shift where I only want to receive alerts from 2:00pm to 10:00pm Monday through Friday, and then from 6:00am to 10:00pm Saturday and Sunday.  Currently I am not able to set a shift in this manner.
Allow the individual users to be able to set their own filter for duty schedule. Would be great to have this on web, but better if you can do in-App.

data.name: Split Screen / Multitasking IOS 9

description.body: Update the app to work with iOS 9 Multitasking.  So we can have more than one app open at a time.  Example: Half of the screen Calendar App Half Active 911.  Great for those who have Active 911 Displayed in their stations.
iOS on the iPad has the option to use split screen, and it would be very useful to have both apps we use up at the same time. Not sure how hard it is to add, but other 3rd party apps are doing it.

data.name: Adding/Removing Multiple Personnel

description.body: The ability to add or remove multiple personnel using a .csv file. Similar to the function available for the Map Data.

data.name: Integrate with Techsitters Public Safety SAS

description.body: We utilize TechSitters Public Safety SAS for audio and would like a shortcut on the alert that would allow us to speed dial our assigned SAS number from the alert without closing the alert to use the phone keypad.

data.name: Search Map Data from App

description.body: Not a major feature but one of more convenience. Having the ability to search for a particular map data title from the app's map view would be nice if it can be unintrusive somehow. Maybe an additional button at the bottom of the map to bring up a search bar to type in what you're looking for. This could be useful if you're just searching for a particular data point for information.

data.name: Notification Threshold - Availability

description.body: Allow system to send out automatic notifications if available personal for a particular station group drops below a specified level.   I.e. more than xx minutes from their assigned station (station group).  sent notification to group

data.name: Tracking Order & Location At Time of status changing to responding

description.body: under report - provide the order that people acknowledged that their responding to call and ETA from station. Allow system to set alert for x closest people to station and acknowledge to group when requirement is filled with an update alert

data.name: Large Department Filtering

description.body: Ability to restrict a members view of personnel to those who are in their assigned groups and not everyone on the department (i.e. 20 stations / 400 firefighters)

duplicate_of.name: Clients - Add sorting to the personnel page

description.body: When viewing devices that have signed up.  It would be nice to reorder the list either alphabetically, or by device type, or by person color...

data.name: Responding List

description.body: I see several requests for improvements in the responding list.  I did not see anything that addresses our request. We would like to see some ability to show these responses differently.  Maybe group them by the response name with the number of responses in parenthesis.  Another option is ability to sort them by name of device and by type of response. If we could show the response list differently our First choice:  RSPD (10)	> ONSCEN (2)	> DELAYD (4)	> NOTAVL (12)	> STDOWN (0)	> The right arrow would allow one to see the detailed list.  This detailed list would be sorted by either time they responded or better yet would be by name. I could see pressing the column heading and have it sort ascending/descending. Second choice would be to group them by response type: Member 1       RSPD	> Member 2       RSPD     > Member 3       RSPD     > Member 4       DELAYD   > Member 5       DELAYD   > Member 6       DELAYD   > Member 6       NOTAVL   > Member 7       NOTAVL   > Again having headings to short by name or response type.  The right arrow would allow one to see the details on the response time, etc. I could also see it would be nice to have on the detail list of each response, to look up the phone number from the device list and show it here so someone could make a call easily if they needed to contact that person to bring equipment, get redirected, etc.

duplicate_of.name: Clients - Add sorting to the personnel page

description.body: When viewing devices that have signed up.  It would be nice to reorder the list either alphabetically, or by device type, or by person color...

data.name: Scheduling

description.body: Have the ability to set the default times on the event scheduler. We use it to have our volunteers signup for 24 hr shifts our shifts are 0800 to 0800. I would also like to see the scheduler have a permission to add & view, but not edit or delete. This way volunteers can add their shifts without accidentally removing someone else's shift.
We would like some kind of way to create custom schedules that work for our agency.  Something that allows us to name and define a week or two week period of on and off shifts.

data.name: Map tracking of reponse location

description.body: The ability to track where someone was when they hit available.  We require members to respond to the station and are trying to find a better method of keeping track of this information.

duplicate_of.name: Client Path History like a Bread Crumb Trail

description.body: The ability of the system to show a bread crumb trail of where people have been. Would be very helpful in a land or water search to have the ability to graphically show where people have been. I understand battery life would or could be an issue. For example we do multiple large body water searches and a active911 device on multiple boats being tracked on a active911 device at command would be very helpful. The bread crumb trail would show you any possible missed spots , coordination would be easier and radio traffic would be reduced. Hourly screen shots would provide a chronological timeline of the search.

data.name: Singular pagegroup Administrator

description.body: Being able to have a Group Administrator that that he/she can send out information to their group only.  There access is restricted to seeing only the group members that they are the administrator for.  Group Admin will not be able to add new devices, but could do info pages/alerts etc without having to involve a agency admin or have access to other groups within an agency.

data.name: General Folder

description.body: A general folder accessible by all users from their devices. A folder to place files such as department rosters, department SOP's, etc.

data.name: Scheduling/Recurrence

description.body: Under the Scheduling tab when adding an event you provide the option for a recurring event but only from 1-8 days, is it possible to add recurrences to include every 2 weeks, monthly, yearly or even a custom setting where we could pick specific days, sequences and so forth?  I apologize if this has already been suggested.  Thanks

Revisit Assignments to see how we can make it more useful for scheduling.

Some things that may help:

https://bart.emerg.com.au/system-tour/ramp/

we have a login: Ask Bryan re: #Assignments 2.0

data.name: Filter device tab by device status (Activation)

description.body: It would be nice to be able to filter the device list to see only those who have been entered into a subscription but have not activated their registered device.  This would allow for administrators to better follow up and find out whether there is a problem or perhaps a subscription is being wasted.

data.name: Split screen

description.body: A split screen option would be extremely beneficial when utilizing the map data points while en route to locations marked with map data points. The value of being able to provide the capability of navigation along with pre-plan situational intelligence would be priceless. The ability to have an understanding of a floor plan, hazards, and pertinent pre-plan data while en route would allow for a more effective pre-arrival coordination, while never losing your ability to navigate. Pretty much an integrated system.
iOS on the iPad has the option to use split screen, and it would be very useful to have both apps we use up at the same time. Not sure how hard it is to add, but other 3rd party apps are doing it.

data.name: Different Alert sounds at night then during day

description.body: I would like the ability to automatically have a much louder and/or annoying sound at night to wake me up easier. This way during the day the alert sound can be a more normal sound and then at night have a loud high pitched tone automatically switched.
Would it be possible to make an option to customize alert sound?

data.name: Show group membership on user's page

description.body: When I open a user account, I would like to see all the groups they belong to. This way, when one agency notifies me that an individual is no longer with them I can tell if I can delete their account or need to retain it because they are also with another agency. This is a very common.

data.name: Hide Non-Essential People Apparatus on Map

description.body: Have the ability to hide non-essential personnel/apparatus map markers.

data.name: Analytics Panel

description.body: Be able to track data. # of calls run by provider. Avg. transport times. Greatest call activity graphs by time of day. ALS v BLS breakdown. If this were an additional fee even...

data.name: Recurring Event Schedule

description.body: It would be useful to add a monthly recurrence for events like 'First Monday of every month'. This would allow a posting for meetings, etc. that happen monthly without having to enter them each month.

data.name: Change Color of Calendar Event

description.body: The ability to change the color of a calendar event would be nice to color code platoon days

data.name: Add Weeks to Recurrences

description.body: Can you please add every Two weeks, every Three weeks, every Four Weeks, every Five Weeks to the Recurrences under Scheduling.  We think this feature is great and will be very helpful when it comes to scheduling our weekend employees and weekly duty officers. We hope that you could add this to improve the new scheduling feature! Thank you so much!

data.name: Calender Devices (GROUPS)

description.body: Be able to put groups in the calenders as well as single devices.

duplicate_of.name: Add GROUPS instead of Individuals to Schedule/Assignments

description.body: It would be nice to be able to add an entire GROUP to Assignments/Schedule instead of individuals.

data.name: Administrator alert when a device is inactive

description.body: I would like to get notification when a device goes to an inactive status.

data.name: Assignments Timeout

description.body: Would like to have the option for when users set their assignment, it times out after a certain amount of time. For example if a volunteer department has an assignment called Staffing Station 2 and a member assigns themselves to the station, the assignment will be removed after a couple hours in case the firefighter forgets to change his assignment.

data.name: Responders Position/Speed

description.body: Be able to see responders speed and position when responding to a call

data.name: Custom Buttons for Page Groups

description.body: Ability to have a different set of buttons dependent upon which pagegroup the alert is sent through.

duplicate_of.name: Differing sets of responses for different device types

description.body: Two sets of response buttons, both customize-able. One set for apparatus and one set for personnel.

data.name: Mapping and Moving Units

description.body: For special events moving units around for staging and shifting units around for coverage.

data.name: Admin device lock

description.body: Have an admin password to limit users the ability to  change any settings. To prevent accidentally putting phone in off duty status when in actuality they are still on duty. Thanks

data.name: On-Duty Tracking

description.body: Track time any given member has status set to 'On-Duty'  In Canadian Volunteer, a tax credit is available after 200 hours of 'on-duty' status, but tracking this is challenging.  Should be reportable/exportable data

data.name: Station/EMS Chatroom

description.body: Create a private chat room where EMS department personnel can communicate with other members either individually or as a group.  Include ability for users to build folders to store information for future use (Tx for Septic Shock, etc).

Able to have a chat screen to text type responding or asking if member is responding over a chat kinda like IM Andy- I'm responding to the ambulance Ben- okay I'll meet you at the scene. Andy- okay I'll respond

data.name: Download Group Members

description.body: The ability to download alarms is fantastic. To be able to do the same for group members would be very helpful in managing users. Volunteers turn-over frequently and removing them is very important. If I could get a list each month for each group/department and email it for verification we could more easily guarantee compliance.
Be able to export the device list would be a handy feature

data.name: Assign Alert Type per Alarm

description.body: Would be a great feature to have the ability to assign the type of alert based on the type of alarm, Medical, Fire, Or General, etc.

data.name: Stop SMS provider from trying to use a local mobile number

description.body: In New Zealand (and possibly other countries) our mobile phone providers block international SMS providers that attempt to use local numbers. This makes the SMS function of Active911 100% useless in our country

data.name: Vacation

description.body: In settings, under duty status, add a choice and label it vacation.  That way I can stop receiving any calls regardless if I'm using word filters. I was told that both Auto and off- duty will continue giving me filtered word calls.

data.name: Ability to set availability

description.body: The options now for availability is on duty and off duty. I would like to see off duty changed to on-call, and add a third option: unavailable; so staff can say whether they are in town and able to respond on call-back, or not available at all.

data.name: Paging Based on Location

description.body: Page different groups dependent upon a defined area of the map.  Be able to draw a polygon, save it and assign groups that get pages for anything within that polygon.

Would like to see a feature that would send alerts to my device only if the call for service was a certain radius from my location.  In other words I'm out and about and I don't want an alert on every single call within out 654 square mile county, but a CPR comes out a few blocks from my location, I want to be alerted.  I could see this as a user defined switch that would allow the user to turn on this feature on/off (due to potential battery drain).  It could also be integrated as one of the on/off duty options.  Maybe I'm on shift and I want to set it to 7a-7p today.  The next day I'm off and want to set it to geofence only.  Would also like the radius to be user defined.

data.name: Administrator Tones

description.body: Administrator has the ability to choose which tones can be used.  Some tones thought to be slightly obtrusive.

data.name: address search under alarms tab

description.body: be able to search an address on the alarms

data.name: Image as Attachment in alerts

description.body: The ability to send memos or flyers as attachments to members as an alerts

duplicate_of.name: Add an Attachment to our send alert capabilities.

description.body: As a rural department, When I send out non-emergency messages It would be easier to attach a document to the alert than ask users to check their email.

data.name: Eliminate the pop up Error if GPS is off

description.body: Many of us turn off the Location Services as we don't use that feature, and the GPS sucks the battery out of the phone all shift.  Because it's off, each call gets a Error pop up, or multiple of the same that must be pressed OK to clear and see the call. It's absolutely annoying when walking out to the rig to check the call/address and having to keep pressing OK for our Department.  Thanks! (Sample Pop Up Below)      ERROR Please enable location services to get map routing and crew position sharing.  Please choose ALLOW when asked, or else enable Locations Services for Active911 under Home > Settings > Privacy

data.name: Display Traffic Patterns on WebView

description.body: We would like the ability to display the Google traffic patterns on the map in WebView. This would allow our dispatch center and crew office to see major delays and where our providers are in  relation to their calls.

data.name: Member role / positon

description.body: Display the members function next to name in response page and member list. IE Driver, EMT, Firefighter, Crew, Engineer, Chief, ect.  (John Doe - Driver)

I'd like to have a place to note what service each device uses, such as Verizon, US Cellular, etc. It's hard for me to keep up with this b/c google as killed me by making a separate contact app and screwing everything up so I can't just send everyone an email or text. Damn nightmare...

data.name: Mobile Picture to Map Data

description.body: I would like to use my smartphone and snap a picture of buildings, entrances, hydrants, key features and add them to map data directly from smartphone in the field.

data.name: Selectable Icon Map Marker Density

description.body: It would be nice if you were able to differentiate the Map Marker Density by Icon. For example, in a small community it is helpful to have the hydrant density viewed on the normal level, while the close proximity of the downtown shopping blocks would best be viewed on the urban or even dense urban level. Allowing selectable density levels per icon would help clear up the map at different zoom levels and give a more user friendly interface.

data.name: Map tags

description.body: Instead of a key, tag, or other symbol on the map locations that require you to tap the location to see extra info, allow letters or number symbols on the map... For door numbers or other department specific info..

data.name: additional apparatus views

description.body: The availability to see other tablets that respond to mutual aid. Allows the option to see location and response route.

duplicate_of.name: Share device locations with other agencies for mutual aid

description.body: create the ability to share devices to other agencies for viewing Apparatus Locations of our Mutual Aid agencies. This would be very similar to the map data share feature

data.name: Alarm CSV Customization

description.body: Need to be able to customize the spread sheet to work for each agency.

data.name: Alert Tones based on priority (call)

description.body: Every call from dispatch has a priority attached to it. Setting different alert tones based on the priority would be awesome. Then I can set EMS runs to STFU (vibrate) cause who really cares about EMS. Or changing alarm notification, priority 6 (aka alarm co testing alarm) to IDGAF (no alert) so when we are sleeping at 0300 our phones aren't all LEEEEEE ROOYYYYYYYYYYYY JJJJJEENNNNNNNNNNKINS. Unless its your wife texting me or a structure fire I prefer to not here the BS. PS- I'm riding the medic today. UGH

data.name: Configurable wecome mail

description.body: How about an option that could be an editable email that each agency would write their own, depending on their policies.

data.name: Auto send welcome mail

description.body: How about an option to auto send (or not) the welcome email to new users you've created. Few things more aggravating than adding a big batch of users and then having to jump page to page to find them all and send the welcome letter manually, one by one.

data.name: The ability to add a map key

description.body: It would be nice to add a map key or a link to a map key so our personnel can see why we used a red building over an orange building.

data.name: Pagegroup Name on Manual Alerts

description.body: When a manual alert is sent from a phone or the internet, the message does not show what page group the message was sent to.  If someone monitors multiple groups, they do not know which agency the message was for.

data.name: Ability to select on duty for certain types of calls

description.body: Every CAD System has a list of Category Codes that it uses such as Structure Fire or Traffic Accident. Set up to be able to be paged similar to page groups for units but also via incident type. On agency that are combination or that run and ambulance, a lot of people don't want to get every EMS call, but fire calls only as the paid staff can be recalled in for this.

admin_response.body: This sounds a lot like filters. How to set up filters.

data.name: Send out a message different acknowledgements

description.body: Be able to send out a page and edit what acknowledgements they have to respond with. For example: Need coverage for third out medic. Need two. Then the options would be: Unavailable, Available. Time stamps would be needed for the replies.

data.name: Suspend Alerts to specific user

description.body: I would like to see the ability to suspend an alert for an individual device. We have had personnel take a leave of absence and it would be nice to be able to suspend their activity for a specific duration or back to work date. More than just the off duty selection. This option would be from an administration level.

data.name: In app messages to certain groups

description.body: Give people permissions to send messages or alerts to specific groups. for example a chief could have access to all groups where as a company captain would have permissions to alert or message only his company.

data.name: Changing Names for Specific Agencies

description.body: Being able to edit a name for a specific agency (IE: Captain for one agency, Firefighter Only for another). As it stands right now, when you edit the name of a person who has multiple agencies, it changes it across the board. If you are an officer for one dept, and not another, this gets confusing.

data.name: Tasker Integration

description.body: Would like to see Tasker integration for more refined notification control and system interactions.

data.name: Allow individual user to set their shift.

description.body: Individual users can not use the Duty status of Auto without an admin setting up their shift. An admin should set up the departments shifts, A B C et. and then the individual users should be able to choose their shift in the app. That way admin does not have to constantly track that (especially in a large department) and a user could choose a different shift easily if they are on a temporary assignment on a different shift.

data.name: Disable on/off duty

description.body: I have members who somehow mark themselves off duty and then report they aren't getting calls. The ability to prevent them from doing this as an agency setting would be great. Or the ability to allow them to go off duty for a set period of time and then the system would automatically put them on duty again.

admin_response.body: If you want everyone to always get every call, regardless of duty status you can create an always group.  More info can be found here

data.name: Night View for iPhone

description.body: Similar to the Androids, a darker background for night time would be nice on the iOS version.
Add a night/dark theme for iOS.

data.name: Layers

description.body: Be able to layer maps and toggle maps. Hydrants, Preplans Hazards Water Supply ETC make it where you can add categories to the map.  With all the hydrants, you cant add preplans, hazards and such because it gets too busy.

Option to view or close map data layers from different agencies. For example. In my town, there are several members who are on both the fire department, EMS squad, and even other near-by fire departments. It gets confusing sometimes looking at a map that includes combined map data from each agency. Sometimes the agencies use different symbols, they may overlap each other. It would be great if a member of multiple agencies could filter toggle to either view or close map markers from the agencies they are apart of. If they only want to view the FD map points, they will have the option to filter out the map points that are linked to their EMS account.

data.name: Add the ability to "Favorite" or pin groups

description.body: I work in a larger department that uses Active 911, and there is a long list of units that I could ride, but generally only ride a handful of those units. I think it would be cool to have the ability to add favorite units to a list, instead of having to scroll through over a hundred units in order to select my unit for the day.

duplicates.name: Users need to be able to create groups of pagegroups or favorite certain pagegroups instead of scrolling through hundreds of groups to find theirs.

data.name: Upload your own placemarker icons

description.body: We would like to add all of the data (hydrants, FDC, Knox boxes etc.) to the map, but the limited icon and color set prevent us from doing this in a way similar to our own map books. We would like the ability to upload our own icons so they can match our books.

data.name: Mandatory status input before seeing alarm details.

description.body: My department is mostly volunteers. we are finding that members look at the alarm and then go directly to the map, without entering a status. If the status update was mandatory, the command elements would get a better idea of how many members were responding. My idea is a screen in between an alert and the alert page with three buttons, green yellow and red, for responding, watching, and unavailable.

data.name: Single Sign On - Google Apps

description.body: Single Sign On integration with Google Apps. This will enable us to eliminate having to have multiple signings, usernames, etc. Once the user signs in to our internal apps site, they can automatically be authenticated in your site to make changes to their account and access other features.

data.name: Mapping to a County

description.body: It would help to be able to Map to a county not so narrow as to a city, especially for mutual aid.

admin_response.body: Our parsers are built do use your county unless otherwise overridden by the agency setting or we recognize a city in the format from your dispatch.

data.name: SECOND ALERT FOR BACK UP

description.body: Make an additional alert email address so that first responders or for example volunteer members of a rescue squad could be toned for back up only and not have to receive the original call if they wish not to. So that for example they dont get alerts for every minor or sick person call, and only be activated if additional ie. man power for lift assistance is needed.

admin_response.body: We have well known pathways for setting up groups that can handle this situation.  Support can help you get the right setup if you require assistance.

data.name: Block SMS message passthrough

description.body: On Android, Active911 application doesn't consume the SMS alert after parsing.  This forces the native SMS messaging app on the Android device to alert and then Active911 alerts again for the same message. This is a feature that CADPage already has implemented.

data.name: Map Data Color Options

description.body: Would like to have more color options for the map data. Maybe a 16 or 32 bit color scale option.

data.name: Prioritize Calls

data.name: I'd like to always get an alert I create.

description.body:
We use Active911 to send alerts when we're trying to get a crew for non-emergent calls for service.  We have several groups defined in the Active911 system so we aren't notifying everyone when we're just looking to announce to a sub-set of our personnel.  However, the person on duty isn't always in the group being notified.  In practice this means that the creator/sender of the alert, if they aren't in the group they are alerting, is doing it blind because there is no functionality to automatically CC the person sending the alert.


It stands to reason that the person sending the alert will always be up and awake.  They should automatically be notified of all alerts they initiate, even if they aren't in that group, so they will have the opportunity to 1) verify that the alert actually went out and 2) edit the original alert and resend, if necessary.

data.name: Print Alert information

description.body:
It would be great if the App was able to send the call information to a printer via email address.  You can get printers that have an email address and print anything sent to that email address.

The idea being, once a call comes in, one of the alerts is sent to the printer via email, which prints the call for someone to lift on the way out the door.  The print out would include call information and a map with a best route marked out.

Best way to implement this (I think) is to add a device category called "Printer" in the Admin Devices page which accepts an email address as input.  The page will then send out a formatted email to the printer email address.

data.name: Custom Vibration on iPhones just like Android devices

description.body: You can set vibration types on Andriod devices, but iPhones don't have but only 1 vibrating alert. This way one can distinguish when a call comes across the phone from Active 911 versus a standard text, email, voicemail, etc alert. What about this possibility? Thank you for all the hard work!!

Add a custom vibration string option so the user can specify the exact length of the vibration. This is usually accomplished with a comma-separated string of integers representing seconds or milliseconds. The values represent the time spent ON, then OFF, alternating. Example: 1000,200,1000,200,1000 would vibrate for one second three times, with 0.2 seconds between the vibrations.

data.name: As a Windows PC App user, I need to be able to see a report of the responses during a call.
As an Active911 Client User, I need the app to give me an audible notification when a calls comes in while I am on a cellular voice call.

description.body: Right now while on WiFi or a GSM network, the apps send through the notification silently while on a voice call. I need an option to audibly alert me while I am on a call.

data.name: As an Account Administrator, I need the ability to turn off responder locations for the entire account.

description.body: Due to abuse or other malicious activity on the account, I need to be able to switch off the responder locations for everyone on the account.

data.name: As an Active911 Client User, I need the ability to customize the vibration pattern for alerts.

description.body: In a loud environment, the audible notification can be hard to hear, so a customizable vibration pattern is needed for the iOS.

Add a custom vibration string option so the user can specify the exact length of the vibration. This is usually accomplished with a comma-separated string of integers representing seconds or milliseconds. The values represent the time spent ON, then OFF, alternating. Example: 1000,200,1000,200,1000 would vibrate for one second three times, with 0.2 seconds between the vibrations.

data.name: As a Webview User, I need to be able to look at the screen and see the list of those people on and off duty scrolling on the right hand side of the page.

description.body: If a department has more than a couple dozen people and 3-4 assignments, the information runs off the bottom of the screen and must be scrolled to view. This should be auto scrolled in a hand-off display like Webview.

data.name: As a Webview User, I need the list of calls and responders to auto scroll slowly through the list.

description.body: When there are multiple calls going on, a person viewing the screen might not see the other calls if the latest call has too many responders. It would be nice to have Webview scroll through the list of calls showing the responses for each call and briefly rezooming to that call.

data.name: There needs to be more data icons geared toward marking non-emergency points, like commercial buildings, fuel stations, etc.

description.body: There are no icons that are clearly recognizable as residential, commercial, fuel station, industrial, agriculture. The only option in currently available Active911 icons is the building icon.

data.name: I would like the response data to be in seperate columns so I can sort the data.

description.body: The response column currently has all of the responses and can't be sorted for type of response. I would like to be able to see who arrived, who was unavailable, etc.
Sort the alarm responders list by responding, not responding, name, location, etc.

data.name: Webconsole Agency Sorting

description.body: The ability to choose the order of the agencies in the drop-down menu at the top of the screen, to the right of your department's name.

data.name: An option to set availability seperately from duty status

description.body:
It would be nice if users could set their status as available or not from the client and have a list of available personnel view-able by at least the web client if not all clients.   Some people want to be alerted so they know what is going on even when they are not available to respond. So, using duty status isn't really as useful, but being able to see everyone's duty status would be a start.

This way everyone can see who all is available to respond at any time.

data.name: Improve GPS support in Windows app

description.body:
We've had reports that our software isn't able to get a GPS location, but other software on the same machine & with the same GPS device/setup is. This would require research to see the limitations of the standard we adhere to for GPS reporting (or our implementation of it) and to see if we can expand on this or adhere to a broader standard.

See OTRS ticket: 2017030210001001 for one example.

data.name: As a developer, I want Jack to create new release docs or add to existing release docs whenever a new feature is merged into develop.

admin_response.body: We are moving away from release docs in general, favoring aha! instead.  This does not seem like a needed step at this point.

data.name: Refactoring access_server web_api to keep core functionality of webview up to date

description.body:
web_api.php was feature frozen and wasn't refactored into the common api. Because of this we have noticed one major difference in functionality for webview in OTRS ticket #2017021610000489 - alert daisychaining / pagegroup forwarding doesn't work for alerts that originate on webview. 

This aha idea is to address potential current differences and others that will be introduced when we make further code changes to the common api. 

An important first (high-priority) target is to do enough refactoring so that web_api can use the common api's version of the send_alert function.

data.name: write list of queued push msgs to disk so that they can't be lost during restarts

description.body: This is an idea I'm proposing in response to an incident on 1/16/2017 and I've heard that there have been a few other similar instances in the past as well. In this particular incident we maxed out apnsd and the queue kept growing for 30 min (into the critical range). The path to resolution is to restart the service, but currently in the process of doing so, all the queued apple push message are never sent (several thousand in this case).
